titleStmt.title: A collection of the several writings given forth from the Spirit of the Lord through that meek, patient, and suffering servant of God, James Parnel, who, though a young man, bore a faithful testimony for God and dyed a prisoner under the hands of a persecuting generation in Colchester Castle in the year 1656
titleStmt.author: Parnell, James, 1637?-1656.

notesStmt.note: Introductory material includes biographical comments about Parnel by several authors.
"The watcher", "The fruits of a fast", and "Goliah's head cut off" have special t.p.'s.
Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
